intro: Pharus micranthus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pharus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions. Its small, showy flowers are usually yellow or orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
